intro: Leucas microscypha, commonly known as the small-leaved leucas, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its small, narrow leaves are arranged alternately along the stem, and it produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Leucas microscypha is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
